basics.name: Dr. Maria Rodriguez
basics.label: Assistant Professor of Computational Biology
basics.summary: Computational biologist specializing in genomic data analysis and machine learning applications in precision medicine. Dedicated to advancing scientific knowledge through interdisciplinary research and mentoring the next generation of researchers.

work.name: Harvard Medical School
work.summary: Lead independent research laboratory focused on developing computational methods for cancer genomics.
highlights: Secured $2.5M in grant funding (NIH R01, NSF CAREER)
Supervise team of 8 graduate students and 3 postdocs
Teach graduate courses in Computational Biology and Machine Learning
Serve on institutional review board and graduate admissions committee

work.name: Broad Institute of MIT and Harvard
work.summary: Conducted research on single-cell genomics and developed novel computational tools.
highlights: Developed CellMapper, software tool with 5,000+ citations
Collaborated on multi-institutional Cancer Genome Atlas project
Published 8 first-author papers in high-impact journals

x_cfrs_honors: Best Thesis Award in Biomedical Informatics

projects.name: CellMapper
projects.description: Open-source toolkit for single-cell RNA-seq analysis with automated cell type annotation and trajectory inference.

projects.name: Cancer Immune Atlas
projects.description: Multi-institutional effort to comprehensively map immune cell populations in tumor microenvironments.
highlights: Analyzed 500+ patient samples across 15 cancer types
Identified novel immune subtypes associated with therapy response

publications.name: CellMapper: Automated annotation of cell types in single-cell RNA-seq data
publications.summary: Developed machine learning framework for automated cell type identification achieving 95% accuracy across diverse datasets.

publications.name: Immune landscape of pancreatic cancer reveals therapeutic opportunities
publications.summary: Comprehensive single-cell analysis identifying immune subtypes predictive of immunotherapy response.
x_cfrs_authors: Cancer Immune Atlas Consortium (M. Rodriguez et al.)

publications.name: Deep learning for genomic variant interpretation
publications.summary: Neural network model for predicting pathogenicity of genetic variants with clinical-grade accuracy.

awards.title: NSF CAREER Award
awards.summary: Five-year grant ($500K) supporting research and education in computational cancer genomics

awards.title: Sloan Research Fellowship
awards.summary: Awarded to early-career scientists of outstanding promise

awards.title: ISCB Overton Prize
awards.summary: Recognizing outstanding early-career scientist in computational biology

awards.title: Outstanding Dissertation Award
awards.summary: Best Ph.D. dissertation in Biomedical Informatics

volunteer.summary: Organized international student symposium with 200+ attendees.
highlights: Coordinated program with 30 speakers from 15 countries
Established mentorship program matching 100 students with senior scientists

x_cfrs_custom_sections.title: Grants & Funding
x_cfrs_custom_sections.content:
**Active Grants**
- NIH R01 CA234567 (PI): "Machine Learning for Cancer Genomics" (2022-2027, $1.8M)
- NSF CAREER Award (PI): "Computational Methods for Single-cell Analysis" (2024-2029, $500K)

**Completed Grants**
- NIH K99/R00 CA123456 (PI): "Pathway to Independence Award" (2019-2023, $800K)

x_cfrs_custom_sections.title: Teaching Experience
x_cfrs_custom_sections.content:
**Harvard Medical School**
- BMI 702: Computational Biology (Fall 2021-2024, Course Director)
- BMI 708: Machine Learning for Healthcare (Spring 2022-2024, Co-Instructor)
- Mentored 8 Ph.D. students, 3 postdocs, 12 rotation students

x_cfrs_custom_sections.title: Professional Service
x_cfrs_custom_sections.content:
**Editorial Boards**
- Associate Editor, *Bioinformatics* (2023-present)
- Review Editor, *Frontiers in Genetics* (2022-present)

**Grant Review**
- NIH BISTIC Study Section (Ad-hoc reviewer, 2023-present)
- NSF DBI Panel (2024)

**Conference Organization**
- ISMB 2025: Program Committee Member
- RECOMB 2024: Session Chair
